alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 16 at 6:17PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northern New York, including the following counties, Clinton and Essex. Portions of Vermont, including the following counties, Addison, Chittenden, Grand Isle and Washington. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 615 PM EDT, Gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Essex Junction, South Burlington, Burlington, Burlington International Airport, Essex, Willsboro, Westport, Elizabethtown, Keene, Shelburne, Charlotte, Mt. Philo State Park, Kingsland Bay State Park, Ferrisburgh, Winooski, Ferrisburg, Port Kent, St. George, Colchester and Monkton Boro. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
